intro: Brickellia seemannii, commonly known as yellow brickellia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or limestone soils and thrives in full sun. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads that bloom in the spring. Brickellia seemannii is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
